meanings.definition: A way or manner in which something is done or happens.
meanings.sent1: She preferred traditional modes of cooking over modern techniques.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the different modes of transportation to the students.
meanings.sent3: In a comical mode of operation, the robot kept bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had a unique mode that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The detective switched to stealth mode to catch the thief.

meanings.definition: A particular form or variety of something.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various modes of art, from paintings to sculptures.
meanings.sent2: Each flower in the garden represented a different mode of beauty.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a colorful mode of decoration with sprinkles and frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense included a bohemian mode with flowing skirts and layered jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The music festival showcased different modes of musical expression.

meanings.sent1: The latest fashion magazine featured the current modes of clothing for spring.
meanings.sent2: She always kept up with the popular modes of hair and makeup.
meanings.sent3: The retro mode of clothing made a comeback at the party.
meanings.sent4: His artwork reflected the artistic modes of the 1960s.
meanings.sent5: The interior designer incorporated modern modes of decor into the living room.
